com.mgnt.utils.textutils

Class VersionRange

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mgnt.utils.textutils.VersionRange
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class VersionRange
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a Version Range. It has the lower and upper limits and allows to check if a version is within range or not and if two ranges overlap or not
    Author:
    Michael Gantman
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VersionRange(java.lang.String versionRange)
      This constructor assumes that the string is a version range in format "[Version String] - [Version String]" It splits the string by the "-" delimiter and attempts to create the range the same way as constructor VersionRange(String, String) would.
      VersionRange(java.lang.String fromVersion, java.lang.String toVersion)
      This constructor constructs the Range with its lower and upper limits.
      VersionRange(java.lang.String fromVersion, Version toVersion)
      This constructor constructs the Range with its lower and upper limits.
      VersionRange(Version ver)
      This constructor creates the Range with the same lower and upper limits
      VersionRange(Version fromVersion, java.lang.String toVersion)
      This constructor constructs the Range with its lower and upper limits.
      VersionRange(Version fromVersion, Version toVersion)
      This constructor constructs the Range with its lower and upper limits

      • VersionRange

        public VersionRange(Version fromVersion,
                    Version toVersion)
             throws InvalidVersionRangeException
        This constructor constructs the Range with its lower and upper limits
        Parameters:
        fromVersion - Version that contains lower limit of the range
        toVersion - Version that contains upper limit of the range
        Throws:
        InvalidVersionRangeException - if lower limit of the range is greater than upper limit

      • VersionRange

        public VersionRange(java.lang.String fromVersion,
                    java.lang.String toVersion)
             throws InvalidVersionRangeException,
                    InvalidVersionFormatException
        This constructor constructs the Range with its lower and upper limits. It first converts String parameters into Version values
        Parameters:
        fromVersion - String that contains lower limit of the range
        toVersion - String that contains upper limit of the range
        Throws:
        InvalidVersionRangeException - if lower limit of the range is greater than upper limit
        InvalidVersionFormatException - if one of the Strings is not a valid version

        toVersion - String that contains upper limit of the range

        toVersion - String that contains upper limit of the range

      • VersionRange

        public VersionRange(Version ver)
             throws InvalidVersionRangeException
        This constructor creates the Range with the same lower and upper limits
        Parameters:
        ver - String that holds a single version
        Throws:
        InvalidVersionRangeException - if parameter is null

      • VersionRange

        public VersionRange(java.lang.String versionRange)
             throws InvalidVersionRangeException,
                    InvalidVersionFormatException
        This constructor assumes that the string is a version range in format "[Version String] - [Version String]" It splits the string by the "-" delimiter and attempts to create the range the same way as constructor VersionRange(String, String) would. If the original String contains only one version without a delimiter (i.e. "[Version String]") the attempt is made to convert this String into single Version object and than to create VersionRange with the same lower and upper limits
        Parameters:
        versionRange - String in format "[Version String] - [Version String]" or "[Version String]"
        Throws:
        InvalidVersionRangeException - if lower limit of the range is greater than upper limit
        InvalidVersionFormatException - if String parameter is not a valid version

    • Method Detail

      • getFromVersion

        public Version getFromVersion()
        Returns:
        Version which is lower range limit

      • getToVersion

        public Version getToVersion()
        Returns:
        Version which is upper range limit

      • isInRange

        public boolean isInRange(Version ver)
        This method checks if the version falls within range. Null version is always out of range and the comparison is all inclusive
        Parameters:
        ver - Version to be checked
        Returns:
        true if Version falls within range and false otherwise

      • isInRange

        public boolean isInRange(java.lang.String ver)
                  throws InvalidVersionFormatException
        This method first converts String parameter into Version and checks if the version falls within range. Null version is always out of range and the comparison is all inclusive
        Parameters:
        ver - String that contains Version value to be checked
        Returns:
        true if Version falls within range and false otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidVersionFormatException - if String is not a valid version value

      • isAboveRange

        public boolean isAboveRange(Version ver)
        Checks if the ver is above the range
        Parameters:
        ver - Version to be checked
        Returns:
        true if version is above range false otherwise

        Converts the String into Version and than checks if the ver is above the range
